function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased use of modular construction techniques leading to potential gaps and spaces for disease transmission.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of virus transmission due to long supply paths","category":"Infrastructure maintenance risk","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cross-floor contamination risk in elevator shafts","category":"Proper architectural designs","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Fixed utility rooms between corridors","category":"Poor urban planning","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerability of residential buildings to pandemic due to high-touch surfaces","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited protection to facilities or objects without considering dependencies or interdependencies","category":"Infrastructure maintenance risk ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the impact of buildings on occupant health","category":"Lack of emphasis on air quality ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain safety and housing stock to the new resilient residential space concept","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Off-site construction and modular construction may lead to standardization and lack of customization, increasing the risk of disease spread due to common design elements.","category":"Improper architectural designs","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transport of exhaled pathogens to other occupants with
